channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The $400 Million Restaurant Man
item.description: Stephen Starr has become one of America’s most successful restaurateurs, making and replicating dining magic at places like Pastis and Osteria Mozza.

item.title: Ron DeSantis just took over $66 million worth of prime Miami real estate and gifted it to Trump for a presidential library
item.description: It's the latest demonstration by top Florida Republicans of their loyalty to Trump.

item.title: After Kirk’s Death, Turning Point Vows to Go On. That May Be Easier Said Than Done.
item.description: Despite a surge in new campus chapters, there is a void left by Charlie Kirk’s murder that has implications for the entire MAGA movement.

item.title: Climate-conscious Vermont ski resort hires goats to mow its lawn: ‘They’re great employees. They take a lot of lunch breaks, but that’s kind of the idea’
item.description: Herd owner Adam Ricci says he hopes to scale it and build a model to the point where it can be used at other ski resorts.

item.title: Hollywood erupts as talent agents circle ‘AI actor’ Tilly Norwood: ‘Not surprised the first major AI actor is a young woman they can fully control’
item.description: The entertainment industry recently grappled with AI during the four-month SAG-AFTRA strike work stoppage in 2023.

item.title: Moscow Indicates Retaliation if Europe Uses Russian Assets for Ukraine
item.description: Amid a plan to lend $165 billion to Kyiv using Russian state assets, European officials are mindful of the possibility of blowback as they gather to d...

item.title: Forget retirement: Martha Stewart wants to be a ‘super ager’—she wakes up at 4 a.m., packs in brain games and pilates, before staff arrive at 7 a.m
item.description: Martha Stewart doesn’t allow herself to sleep in—and the first self-made female billionaire in America expects her staff to bring their a-game by 7 a....

item.title: Red Lobster’s 36-year-old CEO got the company out of bankruptcy. Now he’s plotting the ‘greatest comeback in the history of the restaurant industry’
item.description: “Of course it’s risky,” Damola Adamolekun told Fortune’s Ruth Umoh. “I took over a company that’s bankrupt and had a lot of problems.”

item.title: Mary Tyler Moore Tossed This Hat. Where Will It Land?
item.description: Hidden out of sight for decades, Mary Tyler Moore’s piece of television history seeks a permanent home.

item.title: Internet Is Restored in Afghanistan After a Two-Day Blackout
item.description: No reason was immediately given for why service had resumed. The scope of the blackout was rare, even for a government that had drastically curtailed ...

item.title: Moscow Indicates Retaliation if Europe Uses Russian Assets for Ukraine
item.description: Amid a plan to lend $165 billion to Kyiv using Russian state assets, European officials are mindful of the possibility of blowback as they gather to d...

item.title: Bomb Threat Delays Oktoberfest in Munich
item.description: The German authorities said the decision to close the festival grounds was taken after an earlier explosion in a residential area of the city that app...

item.title: Bronx Building Partially Collapses in Public Housing Complex
item.description: Fire officials said an incinerator shaft in the Alexander Avenue building had fallen in after reports of an explosion. There were no reports of injuri...

item.title: Gaza City Exodus Is Overwhelming Relief Efforts, Aid Agencies Say
item.description: The hundreds of thousands of Palestinians fleeing Israel’s expanded ground offensive are further straining services, aid groups say. Hospitals are ove...

item.title: Earthquake in Philippines Kills Dozens, Officials Say
item.description: The 6.9-magnitude earthquake shook the province of Cebu, killing at least 69 people and injuring more than 150. Heavy rainfall has hampered rescue eff...
